parameter 1: A complete and unedited version of the Michael Larson episode was screened in the TV special "Big Bucks: The Press Your Luck Scandal".
parameter 2: For the U.S. PBS network premiere, 34 minutes of footage was cut from the original print, most of them being the soft-core lesbian love scenes.
parameter 3: A complete and unedited version of the Michael Larson episode was screened in the TV special "Big Bucks: The Press Your Luck Scandal".
parameter 4: DVD episode titled as Big John Morrison.
parameter 5: Due to licensing costs, some of the songs originally featured on the soundtrack of several episodes have been replaced by less expensive tracks (or no tracks at all) on the DVD release.
parameter 6: From January 23rd, 2001 to April 17th, 2001 the German TV station Arbeitsgemeinschaft der öffentlich-rechtlichen Rundfunkanstalten der Bundesrepublik Deutschland (ARD) released the first season of the series. (13 episodes of 50 minutes) From July 13th, 2005 to August 30th, 2005 the German TV station Arbeitsgemeinschaft der öffentlich-rechtlichen Rundfunkanstalten der Bundesrepublik Deutschland (ARD) released a series called "Plötzlich erwachsen!" which included all episodes of the first and the second season of the series "Powder Park" in a cut version of 25 minutes per episode. (25 episodes of 25 minutes) From November 4th, 2005 to December 9th, 2005, the German TV station Bayerischer Rundfunk (BR) released all episodes of the first season and the second season of the series "Powder Park" in a complete version. (Second season startet on November 23th, 2005) (26 episodes of 50 minutes)
parameter 7: Due to licensing costs, some of the songs originally featured on the soundtrack of several episodes have been replaced by less expensive tracks (or no tracks at all) on the DVD release.
parameter 8: Due to licensing costs, some of the songs originally featured on the soundtrack of several episodes have been replaced by less expensive tracks (or no tracks at all) on the DVD release.
parameter 9: In the original home video release, the 'Judy Garland' (qv) songs sung by 'Leslie Nielsen (I)' (qv) are dubbed over with another voice singing nonsense lyrics. This was due to music licensing issues. The original songs are restored for the DVD release.
parameter 10: Due to licensing costs, some of the songs originally featured on the soundtrack of several episodes have been replaced by less expensive tracks (or no tracks at all) on the DVD release.
parameter 11: In the original home video release, the 'Judy Garland' (qv) songs sung by 'Leslie Nielsen (I)' (qv) are dubbed over with another voice singing nonsense lyrics. This was due to music licensing issues. The original songs are restored for the DVD release.
parameter 12: DVD episode titled as Big John Morrison.
parameter 13: A "director's cut" version aired 7/20/2012, and is included with the Season 2 DVD. Added bits: The attractive blonde in line behind Peter and Nance finds romance; an irate patron; the restaurant's elaborate PA system. Kyle MacLachlan introduces the episode, and an extended behind-the-scenes segment documents director ''Jonathan Krisel'' (qv)'s quest for the perfect marionberries for the restaurant scene. Executive producer ''Lorne Michaels'' (qv) and chef ''Bobby Flay'' (qv) make cameos.
parameter 14: Some VHS releases omit the scene where the Dawn Treader is attack by a sea monster. The scene is present in the 2002 DVD release.
parameter 15: In the original home video release, the 'Judy Garland' (qv) songs sung by 'Leslie Nielsen (I)' (qv) are dubbed over with another voice singing nonsense lyrics. This was due to music licensing issues. The original songs are restored for the DVD release.

parameter 20: The home video versions of some episodes have changed music in some scenes. For instance, when they sing "Happy Birthday" at a birthday and when 'Leslie Nielsen' (qv) sings Judy Garland tunes in the nightclub. Presumably this is due to a music licensing issue.

parameter 29: When initially broadcast, the first episode included a scene with Drebin walking past a homemade banner saying "Hello to Howard, Frank, and Dandy Don" - a la Monday Night Football, another ABC program. The banner is not on the video or syndicated versions.
